alert.note: Alert for Broadwater; Meagher (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 2:32PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Broadwater and Meagher Counties through 330 PM MDT... At 227 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles northeast of Townsend or near Deep Creek Pass, moving east at 20 mph. Another thunderstorm was located over the Elkhorn mountains, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, brief heavy rainfall, pea size hail and occasional lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Roads will also become slick, with some ponding of water. Locations impacted include... Townsend, White Sulphur Springs, Newlan Creek Reservoir, Winston, Ringling, Silos, Goose Bay and Radersburg. This includes the following highways... Highway 12 between mile markers 1 and 62, and between mile markers 57 and 87. Highway 89 between mile markers 1 and 7, and between mile markers 38 and 57. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. These storms will be near Canyon Ferry Reservoir. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
